revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-23 19:55:31.000000000', 'message': 'Fix mismatch of tags in dnsmasq options

In some cases (I don't know exactly how) it may happend that
when new subnet, e.g. IPv6 is added to the network, subnets
can change their order based on uuid.
As before this patch we were using in dnsmasq options tags like
"tagN" for subnets (where N was just number based on position of
the subnet in the sorted list) it could happend sometimes that
dnsmasq ended up with mismatch of tags configured in "dhcp-range"
cmd option and set in "opts" file. That caused problem with serving
proper DHCP options to the vms.

This patch fixes this issue by using tags with format:
"subnet-<uuid>" where uuid is id of the subnet. That was it's not
based on order of subnets in the list and will always match with tag
configured in opts file for specific subnet.

As we was currently using port id as tag for "per port" DHCP options,
this patch changes that to use tags like "port-<uuid>" to make it
consistent with options configured "per subnet" and to make it easier
to debug from where each option comes.

Conflicts:
    neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py
    neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_dhcp.py

commit_message:
Fix mismatch of tags in dnsmasq options

In some cases (I don't know exactly how) it may happend that
when new subnet, e.g. IPv6 is added to the network, subnets
can change their order based on uuid.
As before this patch we were using in dnsmasq options tags like
"tagN" for subnets (where N was just number based on position of
the subnet in the sorted list) it could happend sometimes that
dnsmasq ended up with mismatch of tags configured in "dhcp-range"
cmd option and set in "opts" file. That caused problem with serving
proper DHCP options to the vms.

This patch fixes this issue by using tags with format:
"subnet-<uuid>" where uuid is id of the subnet. That was it's not
based on order of subnets in the list and will always match with tag
configured in opts file for specific subnet.

As we was currently using port id as tag for "per port" DHCP options,
this patch changes that to use tags like "port-<uuid>" to make it
consistent with options configured "per subnet" and to make it easier
to debug from where each option comes.

Conflicts:
    neutron/agent/linux/dhcp.py
    neutron/tests/unit/agent/linux/test_dhcp.py

Change-Id: Idaea33d62fa31edd7149ec916ec314438375724a
Partial-Bug: #1848738
(cherry picked from commit 88f2073526c2add7e8aa07656caec4c35c8b8459)
(cherry picked from commit a0730e684d54796fce0574bb314b679bcdd58c76)

[{'created': '2019-10-25 13:52:18.000000000', 'message': 'Remove n-novnc service requirement for TLS configuration

When configuring TLS between the console proxy (where the n-novnc
service runs) and the compute host, some configuration for QEMU needs
to be done on the compute host. The existing code for this requires the
n-novnc service to be running, which it is in a single node all-in-one
deployment. However, when running in a multinode deployment, the
n-novnc service runs only on the controller and not on the subnode.

(cherry picked from commit 1d378dcf6d3699d99838050cc804c64a1862ba8f)

commit_message:
Remove n-novnc service requirement for TLS configuration

When configuring TLS between the console proxy (where the n-novnc
service runs) and the compute host, some configuration for QEMU needs
to be done on the compute host. The existing code for this requires the
n-novnc service to be running, which it is in a single node all-in-one
deployment. However, when running in a multinode deployment, the
n-novnc service runs only on the controller and not on the subnode.
Yet, we need to configure QEMU on the subnode compute host as well.

This removes the n-novnc service requirement to enable TLS QEMU
configuration to occur on a compute subnode in a multinode deployment.

Closes-Bug: #1849418

Change-Id: I8b6970e91ad7f52ff489cb9f776ca216d8f86aa4
(cherry picked from commit 1d378dcf6d3699d99838050cc804c64a1862ba8f)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-23 19:07:29.000000000', 'message': "Fix listing deleted servers with a marker

Change I1aa3ca6cc70cef65d24dec1e7db9491c9b73f7ab in Queens,
which was backported through to Newton, introduced a regression
when listing deleted servers with a marker because it assumes
that if BuildRequestList.get_by_filters does not raise
MarkerNotFound that the marker was found among the build requests
and does not account for that get_by_filters method short-circuiting
if filtering servers with deleted/cleaned/limit=0. The API code
then nulls out the marker which means you'll continue to get the
marker instance back in the results even though you shouldn't,
and that can cause an infinite loop in some client-side tooling like
nova's CLI:

  nova list --deleted --limit -1

This fixes the bug by raising MarkerNotFound from
BuildRequestList.get_by_filters if we have a marker but are
short-circuiting and returning early from the method based on
limit or filters.

Change-Id: Ic2b19c2aa06b3059ab0344b6ac56ffd62b3f755d
Closes-Bug: #1849409
(cherry picked from commit df03499843aa7fd6089bd4d07b9d0eb5a8c14b47)
(cherry picked from commit 03a2508362ecf50463d0659142312a30d0fb91f3)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix listing deleted servers with a marker

Change I1aa3ca6cc70cef65d24dec1e7db9491c9b73f7ab in Queens,
which was backported through to Newton, introduced a regression
when listing deleted servers with a marker because it assumes
that if BuildRequestList.get_by_filters does not raise
MarkerNotFound that the marker was found among the build requests
and does not account for that get_by_filters method short-circuiting
if filtering servers with deleted/cleaned/limit=0. The API code
then nulls out the marker which means you'll continue to get the
marker instance back in the results even though you shouldn't,
and that can cause an infinite loop in some client-side tooling like
nova's CLI:

  nova list --deleted --limit -1

This fixes the bug by raising MarkerNotFound from
BuildRequestList.get_by_filters if we have a marker but are
short-circuiting and returning early from the method based on
limit or filters.

Change-Id: Ic2b19c2aa06b3059ab0344b6ac56ffd62b3f755d
Closes-Bug: #1849409
(cherry picked from commit df03499843aa7fd6089bd4d07b9d0eb5a8c14b47)
(cherry picked from commit 03a2508362ecf50463d0659142312a30d0fb91f3)

TRIPLEO_MINOR_UPDATE. Set a default value in case this variable is

commit_message:
HA: ensure TRIPLEO_MINOR_UPDATE is defined for <svc>_restart_bundle

Containers <svc>_restart_bundle use script pacemaker_restart_bundle.sh
which behaves according to the value of environment variable
TRIPLEO_MINOR_UPDATE. Set a default value in case this variable is
unset (i.e. during stack update).

Change-Id: I59da2d3c50fa30a8f3e557a16367f889b103a6f8
Closes-Bug: #1849503
(cherry picked from commit 81610bdc366527d946304014bcd1782cf0a858d8)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-23 19:07:29.000000000', 'message': "Add functional regression test for bug 1849409

Change I1aa3ca6cc70cef65d24dec1e7db9491c9b73f7ab in Queens,
which was backported through to Newton, introduced a regression
when listing deleted servers with a marker because it assumes
that if BuildRequestList.get_by_filters does not raise
MarkerNotFound that the marker was found among the build requests
and does not account for that get_by_filters method short-circuiting
if filtering servers with deleted/cleaned/limit=0. The API code
then nulls out the marker which means you'll continue to get the
marker instance back in the results even though you shouldn't,
and that can cause an infinite loop in some client-side tooling like
nova's CLI:

  nova list --deleted --limit -1

This adds a functional recreate test for the regression which will
be updated when the bug is fixed.

Change-Id: I324193129acb6ac739133c7e76920762a8987a84
Related-Bug: #1849409
(cherry picked from commit 45c2752f2ce08b314012eff044b01aa7d626b43d)

"}]
commit_message:
Add functional regression test for bug 1849409

Change I1aa3ca6cc70cef65d24dec1e7db9491c9b73f7ab in Queens,
which was backported through to Newton, introduced a regression
when listing deleted servers with a marker because it assumes
that if BuildRequestList.get_by_filters does not raise
MarkerNotFound that the marker was found among the build requests
and does not account for that get_by_filters method short-circuiting
if filtering servers with deleted/cleaned/limit=0. The API code
then nulls out the marker which means you'll continue to get the
marker instance back in the results even though you shouldn't,
and that can cause an infinite loop in some client-side tooling like
nova's CLI:

  nova list --deleted --limit -1

This adds a functional recreate test for the regression which will
be updated when the bug is fixed.

Change-Id: I324193129acb6ac739133c7e76920762a8987a84
Related-Bug: #1849409
(cherry picked from commit 45c2752f2ce08b314012eff044b01aa7d626b43d)
(cherry picked from commit 727d942b2830fb6970d99507f2b5eb1a28df01b2)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-10 11:25:55.000000000', 'message': 'Prevent init_host test to interfere with other tests

The test_migrate_disk_and_power_off_crash_finish_revert_migration test
needs to simulate a compute host crash at a certain point. It stops the
execution at a certain point by injecting a sleep then simulating a
compute restart. However the sleep is just 30 seconds which allows the
stopped function to return while other functional tests are running in
the same test worker process making those tests fail in a weird way.

One simple solution is to add a big enough sleep to the test that will
never return before the whole functional test execution. This patch
proposes a million seconds which is more than 277 hours. Similar to how
the other test in this test package works. This solution is hacky but
simple. A better solution would be to further enhance the capabilities
of the functional test env supporting nova-compute service crash / kill
+ restart.

Change-Id: Ib0d142806804e9113dd61d3a7ec15a98232775c8
Closes-Bug: #1839515
(cherry picked from commit f875c9d12fa03e1eb0d6ac0f3dd95f502ae1e6a1)
(cherry picked from commit 080b4759d3a9500266543989cb92b10cc87ea8d5)

commit_message:
Prevent init_host test to interfere with other tests

The test_migrate_disk_and_power_off_crash_finish_revert_migration test
needs to simulate a compute host crash at a certain point. It stops the
execution at a certain point by injecting a sleep then simulating a
compute restart. However the sleep is just 30 seconds which allows the
stopped function to return while other functional tests are running in
the same test worker process making those tests fail in a weird way.

One simple solution is to add a big enough sleep to the test that will
never return before the whole functional test execution. This patch
proposes a million seconds which is more than 277 hours. Similar to how
the other test in this test package works. This solution is hacky but
simple. A better solution would be to further enhance the capabilities
of the functional test env supporting nova-compute service crash / kill
+ restart.

Change-Id: Ib0d142806804e9113dd61d3a7ec15a98232775c8
Closes-Bug: #1839515
(cherry picked from commit f875c9d12fa03e1eb0d6ac0f3dd95f502ae1e6a1)
(cherry picked from commit 080b4759d3a9500266543989cb92b10cc87ea8d5)

commit_message:
Add functional test for resize crash compute restart revert

During review of change I51673e58fc8d5f051df911630f6d7a928d123a5b
there was discussion about the RESIZE_MIGRATING crashed resize
cleanup on restart of the compute service and how it may or may
not work but is likely missing some things to cleanup like fields
set on the instance during prep_resize and resource allocations
in placement.

This adds a functional test to hit that code and make assertions
about what it does and does not cleanup after the crashed resize.

stable/rocky:
* The integrated_helper change is needed as
Ic062446e5c620c89aec3065b34bcdc6bf5966275 is missing from rocky.

Related-Bug: #1836369

Change-Id: I107d842520c088b4859a3b36621ce6bd8e970475
(cherry picked from commit 8db712fe040b15f2b8bc5538338658d3aac246e3)
(cherry picked from commit c565cab47945146cbbd1f1a75f42fef0fc531483)

When the compute host recovers from a failure the compute manager
destroys instances that were evacuated from the host while it was down.
However these code paths only consider evacuated instances that are
still reported by the hypervisor. This means that if the compute
host is recovered in a way that the hypervisor lost the definition

commit_message:
cleanup evacuated instances not on hypervisor

When the compute host recovers from a failure the compute manager
destroys instances that were evacuated from the host while it was down.
However these code paths only consider evacuated instances that are
still reported by the hypervisor. This means that if the compute
host is recovered in a way that the hypervisor lost the definition
of the instances (for example the compute host was redeployed) then
the allocation of these instances will not be deleted.

This patch makes sure that the instance allocation is cleaned up
even if the driver doesn't return that instance as exists on the
hypervisor.

Note that the functional test coverage will be added on top as it needs
some refactoring that would make the bugfix non backportable.

Conflicts:
      nova/compute/manager.py
Conflict is due to not having I8ec3a3a697e55941ee447d0b52d29785717e4bf0
in Rocky. Also changes needed to be made in test_compute_mgr.py due to
I2af45a9540e7ccd60ace80d9fcadc79972da7df7 is missing form rocky.

Change-Id: I4bc81b482380c5778781659c4d167a712316dab4
Closes-Bug: #1724172
(cherry picked from commit 9cacaad14e8c18e99e85d9dc04308fee91303f8f)
(cherry picked from commit b8f2cd689f0a747778080ba4b6e148e71eb53085)

We would of course use this as a baseline to  move to os_tempest and work out the issues there."}, {'account_id': 8367, 'date': '2019-08-27 13:35:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1

put it in conditional when octavia is enabled.

And here is the error: https://logs.rdoproject.org/35/670135/9/openstack-check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-1ctlr_2comp-featureset020/521c7c9/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/tempest.log.txt.gz#_2019-08-23_23_07_55'}, {'account_id': 6681, 'date': '2019-08-29 12:46:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

 > but then am not sure if the job definition var will trump the

Tried and it seems that the job definition does not trump the skiplist (maybe this is a bug? - it'd be nice if it were). With respect to comments about simply using the 52/standalone (?) featureset - there are filters on featureset overrides. I could extends the list of allowable featureset overrides, but IIRC the pattern around the allowable overrides seem to indicate an "intent" to allow control over some generic items - not expanding for specific setups. In Octavia's case, I need to enable some ansible in the quickstart extras for downloading the amphora and that seems inconsistent with the implied scope of the allowed overrides. Perhaps people who've modified of the list of allowed_overrides in tripleo-ci/roles/run-test/tasks/main.yaml could comment?'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2019-09-10 08:06:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

 > pattern around the allowable overrides seem to indicate an "intent"

 > Perhaps people who've modified of the list of allowed_overrides in
 > tripleo-ci/roles/run-test/tasks/main.yaml could comment?


Looking at scenario10 i see you have run_tempest false (so won't run the 'old' validate_tempest) but DO NOT HAVE use_os_tempest true. Also the tempest vars you are passing are for validate tempest (compare to scneario 7 - e.g. tempest_test_whitelist vs just tempest_whitelist). https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-ci/blob/a7043592537ec4227a23cd6478a15b5c3fccd5b3/zuul.d/standalone-jobs.yaml#L552

Just posted that now https://review.opendev.org/681179 to see what happens with os-tempest enabled - wasn't sure what tests to enable for octavia went looking but couldn't quickly find a octavia specific scenario. i added the network basic ops scenario for now.


WRT the featureset_override -  you're right it used to be much more restricted. It still is, as we have to add into the allowed_overrides, but we have added more recently as was necessary (e.g. for the standalones to have a shared featureset, we use the override instead). So it *is* possible to add something there ;) i think if you have a use-case just post the review and we can have the discussion there.

But it might not be necessary lets see if we can get the os-tempest working'}, {'account_id': 6681, 'date': '2019-09-11 15:30:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 6681, 'date': '2019-09-11 15:31:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11: Patch Set 10 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 6681, 'date': '2019-09-11 15:46:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

commit_message:
Preserve Octavia networks when running tempest

To prevent cleanups of the octavia network resources that are created in
the overcloud during deployment.

Change-Id: Iff54ff52c9db65e3675af69fc17dd9461eb596a5

Containers <svc>_restart_bundle use script pacemaker_restart_bundle.sh
which behaves according to the value of environment variable
TRIPLEO_MINOR_UPDATE. Set a default value in case this variable is

commit_message:
HA: ensure TRIPLEO_MINOR_UPDATE is defined for <svc>_restart_bundle

Containers <svc>_restart_bundle use script pacemaker_restart_bundle.sh
which behaves according to the value of environment variable
TRIPLEO_MINOR_UPDATE. Set a default value in case this variable is
unset (i.e. during stack update).

Change-Id: I59da2d3c50fa30a8f3e557a16367f889b103a6f8
Closes-Bug: #1849503
(cherry picked from commit 81610bdc366527d946304014bcd1782cf0a858d8)

In change I84d2b34d65b3ce7d8d858de106dac531aff509b7, we changed to

commit_message:
Set stack.thread_group_mgr for cancel_update

In change I84d2b34d65b3ce7d8d858de106dac531aff509b7, we changed to
call self._converge_create_or_update() in a sub-thread. However,
thread_group_mgr is not set for cancel_update (with rollback),
which in turn calls converge_stack.

This patch, however, does not enable the test
test_cancel_update_server_with_port, even though
bug #1607714 is marked as fixed.

Change-Id: Ie674fd556418f6aa8e79654458cbe43648851db2
Closes-Bug: #1713952
(cherry picked from commit 3adca03db643275ffda9c1a3203a6e88d7c9d9e2)

commit_message:
Bump min-ready for ubuntu-bionic

Flip the min ready values for Xenial and Bionic. This should've been
done when we did the initial transition from Xenial to Bionic but was
missed. We want to have ready nodes for the common up to date ubuntu
platform (Bionic) and don't as many on the previous release (Xenial).

Thank you to zbr for catching this after noticing that linter jobs took
a while to start.

Change-Id: I5e2c4b6a056b50077ab343535a4bbe3bc49a0acf

commit_message:
Override security suite for Debian image builds

Diskimage-builder defaults to a assuming the Debian security
archive's suite name will be something like stretch/updates or
buster/updates but ours are just stretch and buster without any
second subcomponent, so override this to an empty string instead.

commit_message:
Update ceph grafana dashboard for cinder master branch

There are two changes here:

1. Change tempest-full to tempest-integrated-storage per
   change I38a930d1e8ceef25db0f5b0b26b6402192dc8322 in
   Cinder. Note that cinder still runs the tempest-full
   job but I suspect that will go away in Ussuri since
   it's python 2.7.

2. Change devstack-plugin-ceph-tempest to
   cinder-plugin-ceph-tempest per change
   Ia532b3fcfbecee7c6dc7aa302e6d90a8067b7ff0.

Change-Id: Iafebc4b691db2174c4fedfb649b23555e4c05b60

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-25 01:50:29.000000000', 'message': "Increase tag-releases timeout

When a large number of repos are included in a release request, it's
been seen where the tagging process takes long enough per repo that we
sometimes run into timeouts. To help avoid this condition, though rare,
this increases the timeout setting for the tag-releases job.

Change-Id: I8d22ead8724406203a8f5eda502319be5789ef89
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Increase tag-releases timeout

When a large number of repos are included in a release request, it's
been seen where the tagging process takes long enough per repo that we
sometimes run into timeouts. To help avoid this condition, though rare,
this increases the timeout setting for the tag-releases job.

Change-Id: I8d22ead8724406203a8f5eda502319be5789ef89
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

messages: [{'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-10-17 17:13:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2019-10-17 18:01:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2019-10-21 16:06:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:\n\nAgreed. It should totally be the case after the Testshib wasn't maintained and broke our federation job cases which we used as an external IDP for our keystone. Testing K2K is a better regression testing."}, {'account_id': 16465, 'date': '2019-10-22 16:50:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-17 17:13:10.000000000', 'message': 'Add option to disable testing against external idp

Currently, the federation tests are non-voting because they require
connecting to an external service that is not under our control, and is
therefore unreliable. Non-voting tests are a problem because they are
often ignored even when their results are related to new changes. This
change adds a tempest config option
``[identity-feature-enabled]/external_idp``, defaulting to true for
backwards compatibility, which when disabled causes the tests that rely
on the external IdP to be disabled leaving only the K2K federation tests
to be executed. Exercising only the K2K tests is still a good means of
regression testing and we can safely make those tests voting.

Change-Id: I534470df7ca529511ab9a7631f167ec2035ab4be
'}, {'created': '2019-10-17 18:01:38.000000000', 'message': 'Add option to disable testing against external idp

Currently, the federation tests are non-voting because they require
connecting to an external service that is not under our control, and is
therefore unreliable. Non-voting tests are a problem because they are
often ignored even when their results are related to new changes. This
change adds a tempest config option
``[identity-feature-enabled]/external_idp``, defaulting to true for
backwards compatibility, which when disabled causes the tests that rely
on the external IdP to be disabled leaving only the K2K federation tests
to be executed. Exercising only the K2K tests is still a good means of
regression testing and we can safely make those tests voting.

Change-Id: I534470df7ca529511ab9a7631f167ec2035ab4be
'}]
commit_message:
Add option to disable testing against external idp

Currently, the federation tests are non-voting because they require
connecting to an external service that is not under our control, and is
therefore unreliable. Non-voting tests are a problem because they are
often ignored even when their results are related to new changes. This
change adds a tempest config option
``[identity-feature-enabled]/external_idp``, defaulting to true for
backwards compatibility, which when disabled causes the tests that rely
on the external IdP to be disabled leaving only the K2K federation tests
to be executed. Exercising only the K2K tests is still a good means of
regression testing and we can safely make those tests voting.

Change-Id: I534470df7ca529511ab9a7631f167ec2035ab4be

commit_message:
Add support for running tempest against Octavia featuresets

Modifies featureset038 (multinode) and adds featureset062 (standalone)
to enable downloading amphora and setting some defaults for
running tempest against Octavia on deployment.

Change-Id: I7f0bc4bfa3500f0ff582a151fdc7de44caa060db

[{'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2019-10-21 14:17:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2019-10-21 14:18:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2019-10-21 14:25:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2019-10-21 14:27:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

Yatin has a good point. I think we only need /var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated anyway'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2019-10-21 14:35:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

yatin, see https://review.opendev.org/#/c/689771/1/tasks/collect/system.yml

there will be no log size diff'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2019-10-21 14:36:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2019-10-21 14:43:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

> yatin, see https://review.opendev.org/#/c/689771/1/tasks/collect/system.yml
 > 
 > there will be no log size diff

@weshay i saw that patch earlier and my comment was referencing that only, /var/lib/config-data contains more data, in ^^ only /var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated was collected till now,

i don't have a master deployment, so can't share exact data, i have a queens one which shows like this:-

[zuul@test2subnode-1 ~]$ sudo du -sh /var/lib/config-data/
613M	/var/lib/config-data/
[zuul@test2subnode-1 ~]$ sudo du -sh /var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated/
3.0M	/var/lib/config-data/puppet-generated/

so too much difference, if u have a local deployment(/me don't have currently so can't share exact data) u can check there or not then jobs will put some data when those finishes."}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2019-10-21 14:50:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Scenario 010 multinode fixups

While we currently running this as voting or in the gate, we should keep
it in working state in the event we want to add to some occasional queue
to catch those problems that seem not to occur on standalone.

Change-Id: I67a06d9288115d78bab8be46d42e23f82492d230

We are trying to fix the following issue: 
[remote rejected] HEAD -> refs/publish/master (you are not allowed to upload merges)'}, {'account_id': 21111, 'date': '2019-10-24 19:59:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 24999, 'date': '2019-10-24 20:20:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-10-25 16:02:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Are you trying to propose/review merge commits between branches (e.g., between a feature branch and master)? The default ACLs don't include pushMerge mainly because most of the time when people get that error it's that they're accidentally trying to submit changes from a dirty local checkout and would end up polluting the resulting review (and possibly the target branch if that change were then to get merged)."}, {'account_id': 24999, 'date': '2019-10-25 16:15:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

 > from a dirty local checkout and would end up polluting the
 > resulting review (and possibly the target branch if that change
 > were then to get merged).

Yes we have some branche which changes needed to be merged in master."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-10-25 18:54:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 29585, 'date': '2019-10-25 19:25:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2019-10-25 21:02:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Include ::nova::pci to nova api profile

pci_alias was removed from nova::api with
c3e5c7480f03949a824165349642b59a6077ec5d
We need to include ::nova::pci for the nova api service to have
pci/aliases configured in nova api.

Closes-Bug: #1849797

Change-Id: I5258028ff636e8a6287468499dd6974f6c7f6f6f

commit_message:
Use bootstrap_host_scenarios_expanded for services

bootstrap_host_scenarios_expanded contains final version of service scenarios
so to be consistent about where we look for the services scenario,
it's used across integrated role.

[{'created': '2019-10-25 14:11:40.000000000', 'message': 'Add locale override for space identification

If role is runned for an AIO build and deployers machine has
non-EN locale, awk won't simply work which makes role fail

Change-Id: Iae2ec4e8b7ba5b00c287a029ec0f2415af525402
'}]
commit_message:
Add locale override for space identification

If role is runned for an AIO build and deployers machine has
non-EN locale, awk won't simply work which makes role fail
with "Not enough space available".

Change-Id: Iae2ec4e8b7ba5b00c287a029ec0f2415af525402

commit_message:
CI: Don't set cpu mode

Not setting cpu-mode will reduce the number of TCG emulated features.
Hopefully this will make CI more reliable.

Change-Id: I24a8832c02db6ba019ab8f5c2b9d7216a9b7d213
(cherry picked from commit cc71fd03f9cd7096361efecc8e1eed6b0862eed2)

commit_message:
HA: ensure TRIPLEO_MINOR_UPDATE is defined for <svc>_restart_bundle

Containers <svc>_restart_bundle use script pacemaker_restart_bundle.sh
which behaves according to the value of environment variable
TRIPLEO_MINOR_UPDATE. Set a default value in case this variable is
unset (i.e. during stack update).

Change-Id: I59da2d3c50fa30a8f3e557a16367f889b103a6f8
Closes-Bug: #1849503
(cherry picked from commit 81610bdc366527d946304014bcd1782cf0a858d8)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-25 16:39:42.000000000', 'message': "Stop building docs with (test-)requirements.txt

Change Iba797243d2a137b551223165a1af1a8676bcea02 was a bit
overzealous in using {[testenv]deps} and changed the docs
tox target to also install requirements.txt and
test-requirements.txt which means for docs builds we're
installing things like psycopg2 which we shouldn't be doing
if we don't have the correct native packages installed to
build those types of packages.

Change-Id: Ib718911596b93ec6ec7e899210300d2f0d9572ed
Closes-Bug: #1849870
"}, {'created': '2019-10-25 16:49:02.000000000', 'message': "Stop building docs with (test-)requirements.txt

Change Iba797243d2a137b551223165a1af1a8676bcea02 was a bit
overzealous in using {[testenv]deps} and changed the docs
tox target to also install requirements.txt and
test-requirements.txt which means for docs builds we're
installing things like psycopg2 which we shouldn't be doing
if we don't have the correct native packages installed to
build those types of dependencies.

Change-Id: Ib718911596b93ec6ec7e899210300d2f0d9572ed
Closes-Bug: #1849870
"}]
commit_message:
Stop building docs with (test-)requirements.txt

Change Iba797243d2a137b551223165a1af1a8676bcea02 was a bit
overzealous in using {[testenv]deps} and changed the docs
tox target to also install requirements.txt and
test-requirements.txt which means for docs builds we're
installing things like psycopg2 which we shouldn't be doing
if we don't have the correct native packages installed to
build those types of dependencies.

Change-Id: Ib718911596b93ec6ec7e899210300d2f0d9572ed
Closes-Bug: #1849870

commit_message:
Add venv path to $PATH for db migration

Placement migration tool looks for placement binaries in $PATH.
We should append venv to $PATH to make migration work
in source installs.

Change-Id: I0a062a7424ecc7cdcd5a2b2042cdf1f3faad916b

commit_message:
Don't download image when it's already there

As image should have been already cached in CI [1], we shouldn't
download it again but just verify the checksum.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/src/branch/master/tests/roles/bootstrap-host/templates/user_variables.aio.yml.j2#L226

Change-Id: Ib764c70e483513bec5bd97d4499e67beb4501826
(cherry picked from commit ad4841f70a0ad4ed8090fc3f4c83812204cb59c0)

commit_message:
service_setup: refactor service setup to a single file

This patch refactors the openstack user/service/endpoints creation to
service_setup.yml which will eventually be managed by
openstack-ansible-tests.

Change-Id: Ie7533f10054abe382e21bca875d084449ee3047d

commit_message:
Introduce tripleo-container-manage role

This is a first ieration of the role, but there is still a long TODO,
that will come later in separated patches:
- Add molecule testing
- In podman.yaml, add cpuset_cpus with parity of what is in paunch
- Remove containers that are:
  - managed by tripleo-ansible (using the container_label flag)
  - not in the container-startup-config
- Print stdout when containers start as it was done with paunch

Story: 2006732
Task: 37165

Co-Authored-By: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>
Co-Authored-By: Alex Schultz <aschultz@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I2f88caa8e1c230dfe846a8a0dd9f939b98992cd5

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-25 10:33:16.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Ignore volume exceptions during post_live_migration

Previously errors while disconnecting volumes from the source host
during post_live_migration within LibvirtDriver would result in the
overall failure of the migration. This would also mean that while the
instance would be running on the destination it would still be listed as
running on the source within the db.

This change simply ignores any exceptions raised while attempting to
disconnect volumes on the source. These errors can be safely ignored as
they will have no impact on the running instance on the destination.

In the future Nova could wire up the force and ignore_errors kwargs when
calling down into the associated os-brick connectors to help avoid this.

Closes-Bug: #1843639
Change-Id: Ieff5243854321ec40f642845e87a0faecaca8721
(cherry picked from commit ac68cffd43a2f5103c28a2d4b31e087c3f5c24b9)
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Ignore volume exceptions during post_live_migration

Previously errors while disconnecting volumes from the source host
during post_live_migration within LibvirtDriver would result in the
overall failure of the migration. This would also mean that while the
instance would be running on the destination it would still be listed as
running on the source within the db.

This change simply ignores any exceptions raised while attempting to
disconnect volumes on the source. These errors can be safely ignored as
they will have no impact on the running instance on the destination.

In the future Nova could wire up the force and ignore_errors kwargs when
calling down into the associated os-brick connectors to help avoid this.

Closes-Bug: #1843639
Change-Id: Ieff5243854321ec40f642845e87a0faecaca8721
(cherry picked from commit ac68cffd43a2f5103c28a2d4b31e087c3f5c24b9)

commit_message:
Deprecate deployed-server-roles-data.yaml

This roles file is now the same content as roles_data.yaml as no special
roles are needed for deployed-server. The file is now deprecated.

Note that the intent is to backport this patch to stable/train.

Change-Id: I9407cac224bfba6ae1c6477ff55f2c15937bcd10

commit_message:
Disable cinder-backup in cinder-lvm scenario

cinder-backup[1] does not include an lvm driver, we could use posix
filesystem driver - but it's not supported in kolla-ansible currently.

[1]: https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/rocky/drivers.html#backup-drivers

Change-Id: I847a55692a59c52990186332388f571a04c377b7
Closes-Bug: #1847049

[{'created': '2019-10-24 06:05:23.000000000', 'message': "tox: Keeping going with docs

Sphinx 1.8 introduced [1] the '--keep-going' argument which, as its name
suggests, keeps the build running when it encounters non-fatal errors.
This is exceptionally useful in avoiding a continuous edit-build loop
when undertaking large doc reworks where multiple errors may be
introduced.

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/commit/e3483e9b045

Change-Id: Ied9f46640cf2f338a5784e1c72998f93b5c860c5
"}]
commit_message:
tox: Keeping going with docs

Sphinx 1.8 introduced [1] the '--keep-going' argument which, as its name
suggests, keeps the build running when it encounters non-fatal errors.
This is exceptionally useful in avoiding a continuous edit-build loop
when undertaking large doc reworks where multiple errors may be
introduced.

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/commit/e3483e9b045

Change-Id: Ied9f46640cf2f338a5784e1c72998f93b5c860c5

subject: Workaround ovn cluster failure during update when schema change.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 8297, 'name': 'Sofer Athlan-Guyot', 'email': 'sathlang@redhat.com', 'username': 'chem'}, {'_account_id': 11082, 'name': 'Kamil Sambor', 'email': 'ksambor@redhat.com', 'username': 'ksambor'}, {'_account_id': 17823, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@redhat.com', 'username': 'mbaldessari'}, {'_account_id': 20172, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@acksyn.org', 'username': 'michele'}, {'_account_id': 20778, 'name': 'Damien Ciabrini', 'email': 'dciabrin@redhat.com', 'username': 'dciabrin'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23804, 'name': 'Daniel Alvarez', 'email': 'dalvarez@redhat.com', 'username': 'dalvarez'}]
messages: [{'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2019-10-25 09:40:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2019-10-25 09:44:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:\n\nI believe this is not needed but I'll let Damien chime in :)"}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2019-10-25 09:44:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2019-10-25 12:38:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2019-10-25 12:40:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-25 09:40:31.000000000', 'message': "Workaround ovn cluster failure during update when schema change.

During update the ovndb server can have a schema change. The problem
is that an updated slave ovndb wouldn't connect to a master which
still has the old db schema.  At some point (200000ms) pacemaker put
the resource in error Time Out.  Then it will wait for the operator to
cleanup the resource.  Meaning that the update can goes like this:

 - Original state: (Master, Slave, Failed): nothing updated
   - ctl0-M-old
   - ctl1-S-old
   - ctl2-S-old
 - First state: after update of ctl0
   - ctl0-F-new
   - ctl1-M-old
   - ctl2-S-old
 - Second state: after update of ctl1
   - ctl0-F-new
   - ctl1-F-new
   - ctl2-M-old
 - Third and final state: after update of ctl2
   - ctl0-F-new
   - ctl1-F-new
   - ctl2-M-new

During the third state we have a cut in the control plane as ctl2 is
the master and there is no slave to fall back to. Then we end up
loosing HA as only one node is active.  The error persists after
reboot.  Only a pcs resource cleanup will bring the cluster online.

The real solution will come from ovndb and the associated ocf agent,
but in the meantime, we workaround it by:
 - cleanup
 - ban the resource;
in step 1 and:
 - cleanup
 - unban the resource
in step 5.

This has the net effect of preventing the cut in the control plane for
the last node as we move master to the updated controller which will
form a cluster of one master and one slave (as two are updated).  The
last one will happily join then when it will be updated.

That means:
 - we always have either 1 or 2 nodes working;
 - we end the update with the cluster converged back to a stable
 state.

The problems are :
 - we could hide a real ovndb cluster issue;
- if the update break in-between we could have a leftover ban on one
 of the node;

But, all things considered, this looks like the best compromise for
the time being.

Change-Id: I8f71bf83ddafca167deae1a38ca819f7d930fb80
Closes-Bug: #1847780
(cherry picked from commit 751b3fc09632cf184bf947be8f74d771554a23d0)
(cherry picked from commit d9c60ab05e9d67c35602d3fdf5f2658c49028874)
(cherry picked from commit 9ad87580baec0794e8dafbc11b4c2053fcb146de)
"}]
commit_message:
Workaround ovn cluster failure during update when schema change.

During update the ovndb server can have a schema change. The problem
is that an updated slave ovndb wouldn't connect to a master which
still has the old db schema.  At some point (200000ms) pacemaker put
the resource in error Time Out.  Then it will wait for the operator to
cleanup the resource.  Meaning that the update can goes like this:

 - Original state: (Master, Slave, Failed): nothing updated
   - ctl0-M-old
   - ctl1-S-old
   - ctl2-S-old
 - First state: after update of ctl0
   - ctl0-F-new
   - ctl1-M-old
   - ctl2-S-old
 - Second state: after update of ctl1
   - ctl0-F-new
   - ctl1-F-new
   - ctl2-M-old
 - Third and final state: after update of ctl2
   - ctl0-F-new
   - ctl1-F-new
   - ctl2-M-new

During the third state we have a cut in the control plane as ctl2 is
the master and there is no slave to fall back to. Then we end up
loosing HA as only one node is active.  The error persists after
reboot.  Only a pcs resource cleanup will bring the cluster online.

The real solution will come from ovndb and the associated ocf agent,
but in the meantime, we workaround it by:
 - cleanup
 - ban the resource;
in step 1 and:
 - cleanup
 - unban the resource
in step 5.

This has the net effect of preventing the cut in the control plane for
the last node as we move master to the updated controller which will
form a cluster of one master and one slave (as two are updated).  The
last one will happily join then when it will be updated.

That means:
 - we always have either 1 or 2 nodes working;
 - we end the update with the cluster converged back to a stable
 state.

The problems are :
 - we could hide a real ovndb cluster issue;
- if the update break in-between we could have a leftover ban on one
 of the node;

But, all things considered, this looks like the best compromise for
the time being.

Change-Id: I8f71bf83ddafca167deae1a38ca819f7d930fb80
Closes-Bug: #1847780
(cherry picked from commit 751b3fc09632cf184bf947be8f74d771554a23d0)
(cherry picked from commit d9c60ab05e9d67c35602d3fdf5f2658c49028874)
(cherry picked from commit 9ad87580baec0794e8dafbc11b4c2053fcb146de)

commit_message:
tox: Keeping going with docs

Sphinx 1.8 introduced [1] the '--keep-going' argument which, as its name
suggests, keeps the build running when it encounters non-fatal errors.
This is exceptionally useful in avoiding a continuous edit-build loop
when undertaking large doc reworks where multiple errors may be
introduced.

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/commit/e3483e9b045

Change-Id: Ib1749e690c22663955985f0c3b718ed6223be223

[{'created': '2019-08-21 17:02:48.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Get instances outside of update_available_resource lock

For drivers that can be managing a lot of instances on a single
nova-compute service host, like vmware and ironic, fetching
1K+ instances from the database during the update_available_resource
periodic, with the COMPUTE_RESOURCE_SEMAPHORE lock held, can take
awhile and block concurrent operations like instance_claim when
creating or unshelving an instance, or update_usage when deleting
an instance.

This change moves the InstanceList query outside the lock during
the update_available_resource call and does a sanity check against
the tracked_instances set with the lock held to see if we lost a
race with an instance being deleted or migrated off the host.

This is WIP for now just to see if the re-fetch logs show up in
a normal gate run indicating we could frequently need to re-fetch
the list thus defeating the point of this change and actually
making things worse.

Change-Id: I2e6f8effe77057b413760a8f558972bb6ca1989e

commit_message:
WIP: Get instances outside of update_available_resource lock

For drivers that can be managing a lot of instances on a single
nova-compute service host, like vmware and ironic, fetching
1K+ instances from the database during the update_available_resource
periodic, with the COMPUTE_RESOURCE_SEMAPHORE lock held, can take
awhile and block concurrent operations like instance_claim when
creating or unshelving an instance, or update_usage when deleting
an instance.

This change moves the InstanceList query outside the lock during
the update_available_resource call and does a sanity check against
the tracked_instances set with the lock held to see if we lost a
race with an instance being deleted or migrated off the host.

This is WIP for now just to see if the re-fetch logs show up in
a normal gate run indicating we could frequently need to re-fetch
the list thus defeating the point of this change and actually
making things worse.

Change-Id: I2e6f8effe77057b413760a8f558972bb6ca1989e

commit_message:
tox: Keeping going with docs

Sphinx 1.8 introduced [1] the '--keep-going' argument which, as its name
suggests, keeps the build running when it encounters non-fatal errors.
This is exceptionally useful in avoiding a continuous edit-build loop
when undertaking large doc reworks where multiple errors may be
introduced.

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/commit/e3483e9b045

Change-Id: Icbc670ba49e0cf9e1ce33b33a16231ec64ddf042

So we can not to merge it'}, {'account_id': 28008, 'date': '2019-09-10 03:38:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Actually this patch is not required anymore as infra has partially
 > reverted that commit by https://review.opendev.org/#/c/680683/
 > 
 > So we can not to merge it

So I guess we should abandon?'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2019-09-10 14:15:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > Actually this patch is not required anymore as infra has
 > partially
 > > reverted that commit by https://review.opendev.org/#/c/680683/
 > >
 > > So we can not to merge it
 > 
 > So I guess we should abandon?

Actually it depends on if we want to further rely on infra provided value without reasonable default defined.
So zuul post task is supposed to be runned only by zuul. So if infra will decide to drop passing this variable all in all - we'll still have working ara after that.

But yes, it's not essential and we can abandon it. Just don't know how to act better."}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2019-10-25 16:45:24.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

abandoned as not really required'}]

commit_message:
Set default for ara_report_type to html

As zuul do not define  ara_report_type variable any more [1]
we need to change our default to get ara reports working again.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/680501

Change-Id: I4d2e71a37a9a587d04deab5b421b3d1ffb963b6c

commit_message:
Simplify octavia post deploy configs

Octavia shares config across multiple services in sometimes unexpected
ways. To avoid problems, this patch merges external deploy tasks
configuration into a single file.

Related-Bug: #1836074

Co-Authored-By: Brent Eagles <beagles@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I8da16dd77b77b8d81510cb1818f5d8c572080825
(cherry picked from commit a8bdaf8d55a5ec4536afe9bbc8f87acecbc1f611)

commit_message:
Correct the IPv6 address and port parsing

There can be lot of possibility for IPv6 address with port,
for example [::1]:80 or [2001:db8:85a3::8a2e:370]:7334.

Parsing that in more standard way is provided by oslo_uilts.netutils
parse_host_port() method[1].

Also unquote '[]' the SERVICE_HOST in case of IPv6 case so that
DB can listen on correct address.

Story: #2006309
Task: #36028

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.utils/blob/1b8bafb391b82665b99b3da8205402ec2cd495d1/oslo_utils/netutils.py#L37

Change-Id: I2d0ef40ab71f60564549d031185f99bc7eec40a7

'}, {'created': '2019-10-17 14:03:24.000000000', 'message': 'Make sure tox install requirements.txt with upper-constraints

Ieb4ab13cf8ca5683fcd7b18ed669e8a26659bff1 removed the upper-constraints
from the install_command which caused that only the test-requirements
are installed with the upper-constraints enforced. This caused that when
tox installed nova in the virtual env it installed the content of the
requirement.txt without enforcing the upper-constraints. Today networkx
2.4 package has been released to pypi. The taskflow lib depends on
networkx but does not pin the requirement but the openstack
upper-constraints pins the networkx requirements properly. Nova depends
on taskflow therefore when nova is installed by tox without the
upper-constraints the new networkx 2.4 is installed. This broke the nova
unit tests.

This patch makes sure that all the requirements are installed with the
upper-constraints enforced.

commit_message:
Make sure tox install requirements.txt with upper-constraints

Ieb4ab13cf8ca5683fcd7b18ed669e8a26659bff1 removed the upper-constraints
from the install_command which caused that only the test-requirements
are installed with the upper-constraints enforced. This caused that when
tox installed nova in the virtual env it installed the content of the
requirement.txt without enforcing the upper-constraints. Today networkx
2.4 package has been released to pypi. The taskflow lib depends on
networkx but does not pin the requirement but the openstack
upper-constraints pins the networkx requirements properly. Nova depends
on taskflow therefore when nova is installed by tox without the
upper-constraints the new networkx 2.4 is installed. This broke the nova
unit tests.

This patch makes sure that all the requirements are installed with the
upper-constraints enforced.

Change-Id: Iba797243d2a137b551223165a1af1a8676bcea02
Closes-Bug: #1848499

subject: Eliminate client race condition in convergence delete
messages: [{'account_id': 14567, 'date': '2019-10-14 18:06:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14567, 'date': '2019-10-16 11:57:36.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to 1669608_pike_backport'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-10-16 13:37:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nFixes a bug. Clean backport. Merged in Queens. This code has had quite a while to bed in on Q-> with no complaints, so it should be pretty low-risk. Test patches based on top of this that remove the guardrails are passing.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-10-25 14:45:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-14 18:06:58.000000000', 'message': "Eliminate client race condition in convergence delete

Previously when doing a delete in convergence, we spawned a new thread to
start the delete. This was to ensure the request returned without waiting
for potentially slow operations like deleting snapshots and stopping
existing workers (which could have caused RPC timeouts).

The result, however, was that the stack was not guaranteed to be
DELETE_IN_PROGRESS by the time the request returned. In the case where a
previous delete had failed, a client request to show the stack issued soon
after the delete had returned would likely show the stack status as
DELETE_FAILED still. Only a careful examination of the updated_at timestamp
would reveal that this corresponded to the previous delete and not the one
just issued. In the case of a nested stack, this could leave the parent
stack effectively undeletable. (Since the updated_at time is not modified
on delete in the legacy path, we never checked it when deleting a nested
stack.)

To prevent this, change the order of operations so that the stack is first
put into the DELETE_IN_PROGRESS state before the delete_stack call returns.
Only after the state is stored, spawn a thread to complete the operation.

Since there is no stack lock in convergence, this gives us the flexibility
to cancel other in-progress workers after we've already written to the
Stack itself to start a new traversal.

The previous patch in the series means that snapshots are now also deleted
after the stack is marked as DELETE_IN_PROGRESS. This is consistent with
the legacy path.

Change-Id: Ib767ce8b39293c2279bf570d8399c49799cbaa70
Story: #1669608
Task: 23174
(cherry picked from commit e63778efc91869efbd41e2f96b0c554aef1c80e5)
(cherry picked from commit a13476e7875cca6424abe4c699c1ffc87d9ba4bb)
"}]
commit_message:
Eliminate client race condition in convergence delete

Previously when doing a delete in convergence, we spawned a new thread to
start the delete. This was to ensure the request returned without waiting
for potentially slow operations like deleting snapshots and stopping
existing workers (which could have caused RPC timeouts).

The result, however, was that the stack was not guaranteed to be
DELETE_IN_PROGRESS by the time the request returned. In the case where a
previous delete had failed, a client request to show the stack issued soon
after the delete had returned would likely show the stack status as
DELETE_FAILED still. Only a careful examination of the updated_at timestamp
would reveal that this corresponded to the previous delete and not the one
just issued. In the case of a nested stack, this could leave the parent
stack effectively undeletable. (Since the updated_at time is not modified
on delete in the legacy path, we never checked it when deleting a nested
stack.)

To prevent this, change the order of operations so that the stack is first
put into the DELETE_IN_PROGRESS state before the delete_stack call returns.
Only after the state is stored, spawn a thread to complete the operation.

Since there is no stack lock in convergence, this gives us the flexibility
to cancel other in-progress workers after we've already written to the
Stack itself to start a new traversal.

The previous patch in the series means that snapshots are now also deleted
after the stack is marked as DELETE_IN_PROGRESS. This is consistent with
the legacy path.

Change-Id: Ib767ce8b39293c2279bf570d8399c49799cbaa70
Story: #1669608
Task: 23174
(cherry picked from commit e63778efc91869efbd41e2f96b0c554aef1c80e5)
(cherry picked from commit a13476e7875cca6424abe4c699c1ffc87d9ba4bb)

commit_message:
Fix invalid variable issue with StorageNFS

The `ganesha_vip` comes from a network
called StorageNFS; but its lookup in the
`net_vip_map` dictionary was incorrect.

Change-Id: I5a8b49cce65963d35b610e138808030ed84de2de
Closes-Bug: #1849393
(cherry picked from commit e3625095eab3adbdeb65175cd7fe31688ac1306b)

subject: Delete snapshots using contemporary resources
messages:
[{'account_id': 14567, 'date': '2019-10-14 18:06:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14567, 'date': '2019-10-14 20:03:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 14567, 'date': '2019-10-14 20:04:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

the test succeeded for the dependent patch, must be just a CI hiccup'}, {'account_id': 14567, 'date': '2019-10-16 11:57:53.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to 1669608_pike_backport'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-10-16 13:28:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Needed for the next patch to fix the delete race condition. Clean backport. Merged in Queens.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-10-25 14:45:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-14 18:06:58.000000000', 'message': "Delete snapshots using contemporary resources

When deleting a snapshot, we used the current resources in the stack to
call delete_snapshot() on. However, there is no guarantee that the
resources that existed at the time the snapshot was created were of the
same type as any current resources of the same name.

Use resources created using the template in the snapshot to do the
snapshot deletion.

This also solves the problem addressed in
df1708b1a83f21f249aa08827fa88a25fc62c9e5, whereby snapshots had to be
deleted before the stack deletion was started in convergence because
otherwise the 'latest' template contained no resources.

That allows us to once again move the snapshot deletion after the start of
the stack deletion, which is consistent with when it happens in the legacy
path. Amongst other things, this ensures that any failures can be reported
correctly.

Story: #1669608
Task: 24279
Change-Id: I1d239e9fcda30fec4795a82eba20c3fb11e9e72a
(cherry picked from commit 5ec5a061ea48efb8407b7da5b6a9055b56132ea3)
(cherry picked from commit 990acd83018e929992b02786bfebc1532d017bbb)
"}]
commit_message:
Delete snapshots using contemporary resources

When deleting a snapshot, we used the current resources in the stack to
call delete_snapshot() on. However, there is no guarantee that the
resources that existed at the time the snapshot was created were of the
same type as any current resources of the same name.

Use resources created using the template in the snapshot to do the
snapshot deletion.

This also solves the problem addressed in
df1708b1a83f21f249aa08827fa88a25fc62c9e5, whereby snapshots had to be
deleted before the stack deletion was started in convergence because
otherwise the 'latest' template contained no resources.

That allows us to once again move the snapshot deletion after the start of
the stack deletion, which is consistent with when it happens in the legacy
path. Amongst other things, this ensures that any failures can be reported
correctly.

Story: #1669608
Task: 24279
Change-Id: I1d239e9fcda30fec4795a82eba20c3fb11e9e72a
(cherry picked from commit 5ec5a061ea48efb8407b7da5b6a9055b56132ea3)
(cherry picked from commit 990acd83018e929992b02786bfebc1532d017bbb)

commit_message:
CI: Don't set cpu mode

Not setting cpu-mode will reduce the number of TCG emulated features.
Hopefully this will make CI more reliable.

Change-Id: I24a8832c02db6ba019ab8f5c2b9d7216a9b7d213

commit_message:
Reset *RemovalPoliciesMode for node delete

'update' *RemovalPoliciesMode during 'node delete' can result in
undesired behaviour as we flush the blacklist history and use
the freshly constructed blacklist and decrease the node count.

Change-Id: Iebd0089b6ab35c84e4f20e83f1990c1c5568017f
Closes-Bug: #1848651
(cherry picked from commit 8f5c494150660bacd6a9560c8ce343a0af8e3427)

If nova-api is delayed starting then the nova_wait_for_compute_service
can timeout. A deployment using a slow/busy remote container repository is

commit_message:
Ensure nova-api is running before starting nova-compute containers

If nova-api is delayed starting then the nova_wait_for_compute_service
can timeout. A deployment using a slow/busy remote container repository is
particularly susceptible to this issue. To resolve this nova_compute and
nova_wait_for_compute_service have been postponed to step_5 and a task
has been added to step_4 to ensure nova_api is active before proceeding.

Conflicts:
  deployment/nova/nova-compute-container-puppet.yaml
  deployment/placement/placement-api-container-puppet.yaml

Note: Since this is not a direct cherry-pick due to the placement
extraction in train release, this backport also includes needed
changed from https://review.opendev.org/688399.

Change-Id: I6fcbc5cb5d4f3cbb618d9661d2a36c868e18b3d6
Closes-bug: #1842948
(cherry picked from commit 8a87cbcc349feb9cbd710e91d9805b0db2b8aba9)

Reset *RemovalPoliciesMode for node delete

'update' *RemovalPoliciesMode during 'node delete' can result in
undesired behaviour as we flush the blacklist history and use
the freshly constructed blacklist and decrease the node count.

Change-Id: Iebd0089b6ab35c84e4f20e83f1990c1c5568017f
Closes-Bug: #1848651
(cherry picked from commit 8f5c494150660bacd6a9560c8ce343a0af8e3427)

Relying on crudini being available on the overcloud nodes has turned out
to be relatively fragile. This changes octavia playbooks to use awk

commit_message:
Don't rely on crudini for octavia config

Relying on crudini being available on the overcloud nodes has turned out
to be relatively fragile. This changes octavia playbooks to use awk
instead of crudini to lookup a config item on the overcloud node.

Change-Id: I78d6d753df46c3964b9a4867eb93767230c4dae6
Closes-Bug: #1814320

commit_message:
Containerized control plane with Dell EMC ScaleIO storage

ScaleIO requires a few additional volumes to be mounted
into a containerized control plane. Add GlanceApiOptVolumes
parameter for glance and utilize CinderVolumeOptVolumes and
NovaComputeOptVolumes to supply these volumes.

Change-Id: Ib2865b85f31651e485869cd5772afb9b274c6e57
(cherry-picked from commit f514438be0b1286cf6aa33221e70054d106004ae)

commit_message:
Only configure libvirt-guests if enabled

If NovaResumeGuestsStateOnHostBoot is not true, there is no
reason to configure libvirt-guests.

Also a customized libvirt-guests systemd unit file is added
via [1] which already has the dependencies configured. Therefore
there is no need to manage them via puppet again.

Related-Bug: #1849264
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/690626

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/deployment/nova/nova-compute-container-puppet.yaml#L777

commit_message:
Don't rely on crudini for octavia config

Relying on crudini being available on the overcloud nodes has turned out
to be relatively fragile. This changes octavia playbooks to use awk
instead of crudini to lookup a config item on the overcloud node.

Change-Id: I78d6d753df46c3964b9a4867eb93767230c4dae6
Closes-Bug: #1814320
(cherry picked from commit a2ad746d9de877d6bcc6e9dcc40bdec789630006)

Sphinx 1.8 introduced [1] the '--keep-going' argument which, as its name

commit_message:
tox: Keeping going with docs

Sphinx 1.8 introduced [1] the '--keep-going' argument which, as its name
suggests, keeps the build running when it encounters non-fatal errors.
This is exceptionally useful in avoiding a continuous edit-build loop
when undertaking large doc reworks where multiple errors may be
introduced.

[1] https://github.com/sphinx-doc/sphinx/commit/e3483e9b045

Change-Id: Idec07bdb441a2f30351267686f2f74888655a6df

commit_message:
Add second fact to ensure type safty

The logins json can be both a hash and a string, depending on how it is
being set by the deployer. To ensure that we're able to cover both cases
this change will test the initial data type and react accordingly.

Closes-Bug: #1849747
Change-Id: I443bc36ca8808e1547da37f207b011031120067f

commit_message:
Bump to hacking 1.1.0

This brings in a couple of new checks which must be addressed, many of
which involve a rather large amount of changes, so these are ignored for
now. A series of follow-up changes will resolved these.

'pycodestyle' is added as a dependency rather than it being pulled in
transitively. This is necessary since we're using it in tests.

Change-Id: I35c654bd39f343417e0a1124263ff31dcd0b05c9
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-23 12:24:13.000000000', 'message': 'Less agressive cleanup of docker containers in post_upgrade_tasks

"system prune -a -f" deletes unused container images, as well as
containers which are stopped. This removes useful HA containers
*_init_bundle and *_restart_bundle, which makes debugging more
complex. This also removes tags whose image id are used by
pacemaker HA container.

Reduce the effect of cleanup by keeping stopped containers, which
in effect ensures that we also keep the tags used by HA containers.

Note: keep the aggressive cleanup for upgrade_tasks, because
they are always followed by deployed tasks, which recreate the
missing containers.

Note2: This doesn't apply for podman containers, whose cleanup
looks similar but is not as aggressive.

Change-Id: I936fb965687b961602e677bcca72f403121cbb0d
Closes-Bug: #1846368
(cherry picked from commit ae453229a88c0bad8482901c72a950ca729c6fc5)
'}]
commit_message:
Less agressive cleanup of docker containers in post_upgrade_tasks

"system prune -a -f" deletes unused container images, as well as
containers which are stopped. This removes useful HA containers
*_init_bundle and *_restart_bundle, which makes debugging more
complex. This also removes tags whose image id are used by
pacemaker HA container.

Reduce the effect of cleanup by keeping stopped containers, which
in effect ensures that we also keep the tags used by HA containers.

Note: keep the aggressive cleanup for upgrade_tasks, because
they are always followed by deployed tasks, which recreate the
missing containers.

Note2: This doesn't apply for podman containers, whose cleanup
looks similar but is not as aggressive.

Change-Id: I936fb965687b961602e677bcca72f403121cbb0d
Closes-Bug: #1846368
(cherry picked from commit ae453229a88c0bad8482901c72a950ca729c6fc5)

[{'created': '2019-10-24 08:33:05.000000000', 'message': 'HA: ensure TRIPLEO_MINOR_UPDATE is defined for <svc>_restart_bundle

Containers <svc>_restart_bundle use script pacemaker_restart_bundle.sh
which behaves according to the value of environment variable
TRIPLEO_MINOR_UPDATE. Set a default value in case this variable is
unset (i.e. during stack update).

Change-Id: I59da2d3c50fa30a8f3e557a16367f889b103a6f8
Closes-Bug: #1849503
(cherry picked from commit 81610bdc366527d946304014bcd1782cf0a858d8)
'}]
commit_message:
HA: ensure TRIPLEO_MINOR_UPDATE is defined for <svc>_restart_bundle

Containers <svc>_restart_bundle use script pacemaker_restart_bundle.sh
which behaves according to the value of environment variable
TRIPLEO_MINOR_UPDATE. Set a default value in case this variable is
unset (i.e. during stack update).

Change-Id: I59da2d3c50fa30a8f3e557a16367f889b103a6f8
Closes-Bug: #1849503
(cherry picked from commit 81610bdc366527d946304014bcd1782cf0a858d8)

commit_message:
coreos: Use heat params for heat-agent image

In the fedora coreos driver we should take the heat-agent
image from the parameters provided in the templates.

Change-Id: I48081b57192738b00fe14317d2488e658020a0ea
Signed-off-by: Spyros Trigazis <spyridon.trigazis@cern.ch>

messages:
[{'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-10-23 04:52:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-10-23 04:55:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-10-23 16:44:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Surprisingly simple, I'll throw this as a depends-on to a nova change to re-enable this in the nova-next job when it's multinode."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-10-23 16:49:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/683988/ failed the novnc test on an instance that was on the subnode so we're missing something here."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-10-24 13:51:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

(1 comment)

The problem is in the job definition, not this code. I'll fix the job."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-10-24 23:37:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

This has been verified to work in the nova change that Depends-On this patch:

https://review.opendev.org/683988

"""
Server landed on the subnode for the novnc test:

https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/2e4b52b92e7c40749a57cc4c28cce0f2/log/controller/logs/screen-n-novnc-cell1.txt.gz#17

connecting to: 10.176.161.246:5900

https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/2e4b52b92e7c40749a57cc4c28cce0f2/log/compute1/logs/etc/nova/nova-cpu_conf.txt.gz#25

my_ip = 10.176.161.246

and everything worked.

We also see NOVA_CONSOLE_PROXY_COMPUTE_TLS="True" in local.conf on the subnode:

https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/2e4b52b92e7c40749a57cc4c28cce0f2/log/compute1/logs/local_conf.txt.gz#27'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2019-10-24 23:56:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-10-25 02:16:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

lgtm. working in nova-next job'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-10-25 13:52:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/train as commit 540d581df76f3579662b2f25e0c71164b2871b85'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-23 04:52:24.000000000', 'message': 'Remove n-novnc service requirement for TLS configuration

When configuring TLS between the console proxy (where the n-novnc
service runs) and the compute host, some configuration for QEMU needs
to be done on the compute host. The existing code for this requires the
n-novnc service to be running, which it is in a single node all-in-one
deployment. However, when running in a multinode deployment, the
n-novnc runs only on the controller and not the subnode. Yet, we need
to configure QEMU running on the subnode compute host.

This removes the n-novnc service requirement to enable TLS
configuration to occur on a subnode in a multinode deployment.

Closes-Bug: #1849418

Change-Id: I8b6970e91ad7f52ff489cb9f776ca216d8f86aa4
'}, {'created': '2019-10-23 04:55:16.000000000', 'message': 'Remove n-novnc service requirement for TLS configuration

When configuring TLS between the console proxy (where the n-novnc
service runs) and the compute host, some configuration for QEMU needs
to be done on the compute host. The existing code for this requires the
n-novnc service to be running, which it is in a single node all-in-one
deployment. However, when running in a multinode deployment, the
n-novnc service runs only on the controller and not on the subnode.
Yet, we need to configure QEMU on the subnode compute host as well.

This removes the n-novnc service requirement to enable TLS QEMU
configuration to occur on a compute subnode in a multinode deployment.

Closes-Bug: #1849418

Change-Id: I8b6970e91ad7f52ff489cb9f776ca216d8f86aa4
'}]
commit_message:
Remove n-novnc service requirement for TLS configuration

When configuring TLS between the console proxy (where the n-novnc
service runs) and the compute host, some configuration for QEMU needs
to be done on the compute host. The existing code for this requires the
n-novnc service to be running, which it is in a single node all-in-one
deployment. However, when running in a multinode deployment, the
n-novnc service runs only on the controller and not on the subnode.
Yet, we need to configure QEMU on the subnode compute host as well.

This removes the n-novnc service requirement to enable TLS QEMU
configuration to occur on a compute subnode in a multinode deployment.

Closes-Bug: #1849418

Change-Id: I8b6970e91ad7f52ff489cb9f776ca216d8f86aa4

Looks good, thanks Abhishek!'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2019-10-25 13:33:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

It looks like this ended up in master (and later train), but it didn't land in stein. But the "Test Runtimes for Stein" document (https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html) explicitly spells out 3.6, not 3.5. I'm proposing a backport.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2019-10-25 13:43:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

See https://review.opendev.org/#/c/691308/'}]

[{'created': '2019-03-29 06:08:25.000000000', 'message': 'Periodic jobs are failing for python 3.5

Periodic tips jobs are failing because python 3.5 interpreter
is not available on testing nodes. It is decided that Stein

commit_message:
Periodic jobs are failing for python 3.5

Periodic tips jobs are failing because python 3.5 interpreter
is not available on testing nodes. It is decided that Stein
branch should be tested with python 3.6 version.

Renamed periodic tips jobs to 3.6 and added python 3.6 enviornment
in tox.ini to run periodic tips jobs against python 3.6
environment.

Change-Id: I8a763eff7c6524969b1fabf98ab0a5624954d8b3
Closes-Bug: #1822238

an alternative patch exists https://review.opendev.org/#/c/690389'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-10-23 19:01:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-2

Yea this doesn't work because mistral doesn't actually error on the creation of the process lock. What it does it actually create the lock and then totally break later.  We need Threading by default unless we explicitly know it's not under mistral (e.g. invoked via tripleo-container-image-prepare or via openstack tripleo container image prepare)."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-10-23 19:03:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

The problem is it breaks amqp so the resulting errors are amqp errors and not related when we create the process manager in ProcessLock.  It creates just fine, it just breaks mistral completely.

See https://ba0af86af0a63919260b-27ba51e152f37c2c550101a1da9a359d.ssl.cf1.rackcdn.com/690056/6/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-containers-multinode/fc7f2c0/logs/undercloud/var/log/containers/mistral/executor.log.txt.gz


2019-10-23 16:23:57.400 119 ERROR oslo.messaging._drivers.impl_rabbit [-] Failed to consume message from queue: Received 0x08 while expecting 0xce: UnexpectedFrame: Received 0x08 while expecting 0xce'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2019-10-25 10:36:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

@Alex, I believe this approach is correct, but I forgot to issue .get_lock() to trigger the switching behavior exception, I'll fix that."}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2019-10-25 10:39:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2019-10-25 13:36:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

no it doesn't. I explained that it's breaking mistral because the exception does not occur when we invoke ProcessLock"}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2019-10-25 13:37:06.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

this doesn't work"}]

commit_message:
Auto-pick the best possible multi-workers mode

Leverage multi-process workers whenever it is possible. Only use
multi-threading in the monkey-patched eventlet environments, like
Mistral-driven executions for the image uploader. This allows the
dynamic selection for the workers mode, if using tripleo CLI as well.

Related-Bug: #1844446

Change-Id: Idfb4d73e239c1cd9f5605b9c032f8bf1e66dd5b6

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-17 11:15:52.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Ignore volume exceptions during post_live_migration

Previously errors while disconnecting volumes from the source host
during post_live_migration within LibvirtDriver would result in the
overall failure of the migration. This would also mean that while the
instance is now running on the destination it would be listed as running
on the source within the database.

This change simply ignores any exceptions raised while attempting to
disconnect volumes on the source. These errors can be safely ignored as
they will have no impact on the running instance on the destination.

In the future Nova could wire up the force and ignore_errors kwargs when
calling down into the associated os-brick connectors to help avoid this.

Closes-Bug: #1843639

commit_message:
libvirt: Ignore volume exceptions during post_live_migration

Previously errors while disconnecting volumes from the source host
during post_live_migration within LibvirtDriver would result in the
overall failure of the migration. This would also mean that while the
instance would be running on the destination it would still be listed as
running on the source within the db.

This change simply ignores any exceptions raised while attempting to
disconnect volumes on the source. These errors can be safely ignored as
they will have no impact on the running instance on the destination.

In the future Nova could wire up the force and ignore_errors kwargs when
calling down into the associated os-brick connectors to help avoid this.

Closes-Bug: #1843639
Change-Id: Ieff5243854321ec40f642845e87a0faecaca8721

commit_message:
Only configure libvirt-guests if enabled

If NovaResumeGuestsStateOnHostBoot is not true, there is no
reason to configure libvirt-guests.

Also a customized libvirt-guests systemd unit file is added
via [1] which already has the dependencies configured. Therefore
there is no need to manage them via puppet again.

Related-Bug: #1849264
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/690621

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/deployment/nova/nova-compute-container-puppet.yaml#L777

Change-Id: Ic127937ad83eebb47e34c5f36c826f8dcf1048a9
(cherry picked from commit 9d3af781e74a6eb537ad53ca504b6a5994af6b1d)

commit_message:
Update master for stable/train

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/train.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/train.

Change-Id: Icf85e733017c9dc700143c7d9a5bdd9e81a1b373
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Fix incorrect setting of symlink_target_account

The value of the symlink_target_account in etag override. It was previously
being set to the object value, rather than the account value.

Change-Id: I51889d7b19370ceaa66168103cb31d27a8ee3a4a
Closes-Bug: #1829085
(cherry picked from commit e28bc3c292a3c6fba67ba5f4c92068686994184f)
(cherry picked from commit 01c48bc6c3f2c4c44e518e70132e3de769b0f082)

Try to get decryption object key from stored metadata (key_id path from
X-Object-Sysmeta-Crypto-Body-Meta) because sometime object.path is wrong
during encryption process.
This patch doesn't solve the underlying issue, but is needed to decrypt
already wrongly stored objects.

Change-Id: I1a6bcdebdb46ef03c342428aeed73ae76db29922

Partial-Bug: #1813725
(cherry picked from commit 9b3ca9423eb8cf9420a3e98f60cd56dd281b4208)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix decryption for broken objects

Try to get decryption object key from stored metadata (key_id path from
X-Object-Sysmeta-Crypto-Body-Meta) because sometime object.path is wrong
during encryption process.
This patch doesn't solve the underlying issue, but is needed to decrypt
already wrongly stored objects.

Change-Id: I1a6bcdebdb46ef03c342428aeed73ae76db29922
Co-Author: Thomas Goirand <thomas@goirand.fr>
Partial-Bug: #1813725
(cherry picked from commit 9b3ca9423eb8cf9420a3e98f60cd56dd281b4208)

commit_message:
Update bug tracker info of horizon plugins

The horizon team uses deliverable files in openstack/releases reop
to know horizon plugins and their bug trackers.
Some projects moves from launchpad to storyboard.

Also replaces storyboard project IDs with project names
as names are much clearer.

Change-Id: Id65d8072060682698313727e5e9bd5ba1a741979

commit_message:
Release tripleo-common for train

We cut a release with a backwards incompatible change around the
get_undercloud_registry function that is causing tripleoclient docs jobs
to fail. We need to cut a release with the functionality reverted back
to not throw an exception.

Related-Bug: #1849350
Change-Id: I4bd98f655455464b40d522dbb1b732b0f8c6add5

commit_message:
Remove Python 2.7 jobs

Ussuri release won't support Python 2.7 officially [1] so we can
drop CI jobs to test with Python 2.7.

[1] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/ussuri.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/688997
Change-Id: I650ca71c5a7c922a73f20cdf5ceb02caae464d02

Update bug trackers of OSC and SDK

OSC and SDK teams use storyboard as bug trackers.
This commit updates the bug tracker information.

The bug tracker of openstacksdk was wrong.
It pointed to openstack/shade (760). It is also fixed.
